> Well, with n^2 types of things, that means even P2's and above could 
> eventually get hit -- if 150 characters takes 225,000 units of time, 
> something really big like 400 guys would take 1,600,000 ...

400 characters in a scenario?  Even I am not that stupid or crazy.  
Generators have a tendacy not to work when there are already 100+ 
characters in a scenario, slime have this tendacy to stop multiplying 
around 150 characters.  Now, if you indicate why generators don't work 
when there are x number of existing characters and slime stop 
multiplying when there are x number of existing characters, . . .

I'll try using chain-lightning on a slower speed setting (currently 
I'm 8 speed out of the possible 11) to see if I still have a problem.
